humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: According to the report, there are 15 lymph nodes assessed, out of which 2 are positive for metastatic carcinoma. This corresponds to N1 as per the AJCC staging system (New Rule 12: N1 indicates metastases in 1 to 3 axillary lymph nodes). The report mentions 'Positive 2 / 15' in the synoptic report, confirming the N1 stage.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The N stage for this patient is N1 because the report indicates that there is metastatic carcinoma in one out of twelve axillary lymph nodes (1/12) and one out of two intramammary lymph nodes (1/2), with focal extranodal extension in both cases. The N stage is determined by the number of positive lymph nodes, and in this case, it is N1 (1-3 positive axillary nodes). The substaging information, such as the exact number of positive lymph nodes or the presence of extranodal extension, is not considered for the initial N stage determination.
